Ketua Komisi XI DPR Harap Pertumbuhan Ekonomi RI Sesuai Target
05 Nov 2019, 07:29 by Akfa Nasrulhak


Ketua Komisi XI Dito Ganinduto/Foto: Partai Golkar

Jakarta - Pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia sampai semester 1 tahun 2019 masih tumbuh stabil pada angka 5,06%. Pemerintah dan DPR terus berupaya menjaga stabilitas pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia agar sesuai target. "Terutama dalam hal mengeluarkan kebijakan yang konsisten dalam rangka mendukung stabilitas perekonomian dan menjaga daya beli masyarakat," ujar Ketua Komisi XI Dito Ganinduto, Selasa (5/11/2019).Anggota Fraksi Golkar ini mengatakan perlambatan ekonomi global berdampak ke perekonomian Indonesia lewat tiga jalur. Pertama pasar finansial, dimana aliran modal ke Indonesia dipengaruhi oleh kebijakan moneter negara maju.Kedua, penanaman modal asing, dimana sentimen negatif mempengaruhi investor confidence. Ketiga, perdagangan, dimana kinerja non migas tertekan, defisit neraca migas masih tinggi."Nilai tukar rupiah sampai akhir Oktober 2019 sangat mempengaruhi perlambatan pertumbuhan ditutup pada tingkat Rp14.008,00 /USD. Angka tersebut cukup jauh jika dibandingkan asumsi nilai tukar dalam undang-undang tentang APBN 2019 dimana nilai tukar rupiah diasumsikan sebesar Rp 15.000,00 USD," jelasnya."Pemerintah bekerja sama dengan DPR akan senantiasa memonitor tantangan kondisi ekonomi dunia yang disertai isu-isu perang dagang, pelemahan harga komoditas, dan peningkatan tensi geopolitik. Terlepas dari gejolak kondisi eksternal, perekonomian Indonesia hingga 2019 ini tetap terjaga dengan stabilnya kurs mata uang, inflasi, rasio hutang terhadap PDB di sekitar 30%, serta defisit APBN di sekitar 2% yang masih dalam batas-batas prudent dan konservatif," paparnya.Memasuki tahun 2020, lanjut Dito, pemerintah bersama dengan DPR akan mengawal APBN yang akan dimanfaatkan sebagai instrumen countercyclical untuk merespon resiko pelemahan perekonomian."Penyerapan APBN terutama belanja K/L akan terus kami dorong agar tepat sasaran dan produktif sebagai upaya stimulus dalam pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional. Hal ini terlihat dari realisasi TKDD yang selalu tumbuh dari tahun ke tahun," pungkasnya.Sebelumnya, Rapat Kerja Komisi XI DPR RI dengan Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati, Senin (4/11/2019) menyepakati pembentukan lima panitia kerja (panja). Kelima panja itu yakni, Panja Penerimaan Pajak, Panja Penerimaan Bea Cukai, Panja Penerimaan Negara Bukan Pajak, dan Panja Pembiayaan APBN.Pembentukan kelima Panja di atas berkaitan dengan permintaan Komisi XI DPR agar Menkeu Sri Mulyani memperkuat terobosan-terobosan kebijakan dalam menghadapi tantangan pelemahan ekonomi global dengan kebijakan yang lebih kreatif dan inovatif.Komisi XI DPR RI juga meminta Sri Mulyani untuk menyiapkan mitigasi risiko terhadap pelaksanaan APBN Tahun Anggaran 2019. Chairperson of DPR's Commission XI Hopes Indonesia's Economic Growth Is In Line With Targets
05 Nov 2019, 07:29 by Akfa Nasrulhak


Chairperson of Commission XI Dito Ganinduto / Photo: Golkar Party

Jakarta - Indonesia's economic growth until semester 1 of 2019 is still growing stable at 5.06%. The Government and Parliament continue to strive to maintain the stability of Indonesia's economic growth to meet the target. "Especially in terms of issuing consistent policies in order to support economic stability and maintain people's purchasing power," said Chairman of Commission XI Dito Ganinduto, Tuesday (11/5/2019). Members of the Golkar Faction said the slowdown in the global economy had an impact on the Indonesian economy through three lane. First is the financial market, where capital flows to Indonesia are influenced by monetary policy in developed countries. Second, foreign investment, where negative sentiment affects investor confidence. Third, trade, where non-oil and gas performance is depressed, the oil and gas balance deficit is still high. "The rupiah exchange rate until the end of October 2019 greatly affected the slowdown in growth at the level of Rp. 14,008.00 / USD. This figure is quite far when compared to the exchange rate assumptions in the law The 2019 state budget in which the rupiah is assumed to be Rp. 15,000.00 USD, "he explained." The government in cooperation with the Parliament will always monitor the challenges of world economic conditions accompanied by issues of trade war, weakening commodity prices, and increasing geopolitical tension. Apart from the fluctuation in external conditions, the Indonesian economy until 2019 is maintained with a stable currency exchange rate, inflation, debt to GDP ratio at around 30%, and the state budget deficit at around 2% which is still within prudent and conservative limits, "he explained. Entering 2020, continued Dito, the government together with the DPR will oversee the state budget which will be used as a countercyclical instrument to respond to the risk of weakening the economy. "We will continue to push APBN absorption, especially K / L spending, to be on target and productive as a stimulus for national economic growth. This can be seen from the realization of TKDD which always grows from year to year, "he concluded. Previously, the Work Meeting of the House of Representatives Commission XI with the Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati, Monday (4/11/2019) agreed on the establishment of five working committees. The Committee is the Committee for Tax Revenue, the Committee for Customs Revenue, the Committee for Non-Tax State Revenue, and the State Budget Financing Committee. The establishment of the five Panja groups is related to the House of Representatives Commission XI's request that Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani strengthen policy breakthroughs in facing the challenges of weakening the global economy with a more creative and innovative policy. Commission XI DPR RI also asked Sri Mulyani to prepare for risk mitigation for the implementation of the 2019 Fiscal Year State Budget. That includes the revenue, expenditure and financing side.
